wikipediaPreview:
Rise Up Australia Party is a far right[1] political party in Australia. The party's policy platform is focused on nationalist and Christian conservative[1] issues, such as opposing Islamic immigration and religious freedom for Islamic Australians and opposition to same-sex marriage in Australia. The party was launched in 2011 and is still led by Pentecostal minister Danny Nalliah. Its slogan is "Keep Australia Australian". Nalliah is also the president of Catch the Fire Ministries.

The Rise Up Australia Party received 0.4% of the nationwide Senate vote at the 2013 federal election and 0.3% of the nationwide Senate vote at the 2016 federal election.[2] It has one councillor in the City of Casey, in Victoria, Rosalie Crestani.
